# vImageCVImageFormat_GetUserData(_:)

**Function**

Returns the user data of a Core Video image format.

## Declaration

```swift
func vImageCVImageFormat_GetUserData(_ format: vImageConstCVImageFormat) -> UnsafeMutableRawPointer!
```

## Parameters

- **format**: The Core Video image format to query.

## Return Value

The address of `userData;` `NULL` if `userData` isn’t set.

## Discussion

The functions that create Core Video image formats, such as [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_CreateWithCVPixelBuffer(_:)], return a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat]. The following code shows how you create a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageConstCVImageFormat] representation of a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat] instance to pass to [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageCVImageFormat_GetUserData(_:)]:

```swift
let userData = withUnsafeBytes(of: cvImageFormat) { bytes in
    let format = bytes.assumingMemoryBound(
        to: vImageConstCVImageFormat.self).first!
    
    return vImageCVImageFormat_GetUserData(format)
}
```

## Querying and setting the user data

- **vImageCVImageFormat_SetUserData(_:_:_:)**: Sets the user data of a Core Video image format.
